subject: Career
title: Market Rate: Finding Your Number
description: A short lesson to help you apply Market Rate: Finding Your Number.

hook.text: You can't negotiate if you don't know what the job is worth. Research comes before everything.

buildup.text: Glassdoor, Levels.fyi, Payscale, and LinkedIn Salary give real compensation data by role and city.

discovery.text: Look at the range, not just the median. Your experience and skills place you somewhere in that band.

twist.text: Company size matters hugely. The same title at a startup vs. a bank can differ by 40%.

climax.text: Collect three to five data points. Overlapping ranges give you a defensible target.

punchline.text: Know the market before you name a number.

quiz.question: Why should you research salary ranges before negotiating?
options: To set a defensible target based on market data
